channel.title: Alice
channel.description: I've started using this program for school and I find it utterly useless to me. You're very limited to what you can do with it and basically, all of the methods and actions are handed to you. I don't know if it's just because I'm just used to actually writing the codes, but I hate this program. It's for my Intro to Programming class and I'm one of few who actually know some form of programming in my class. Here's the link to their site for it if any of you guys want to try it out. It's completely free, just tell me what you guys think of it. http://www.alice.org/

item.title: Alice
item.dc:creator: @xI_c_E xI c E
item.description:
@xI_c_E wrote:

Interesting, I’m also using Alice as an intro to my programming class… I personally hate it aswell. Next for me is Greenfoot which I believe is almost the same thing, and then finally we move onto Eclipse.

Read full topic

item.title: Alice
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:3, topic:483800”]at a glance it seems similar to flash

it seems useful for teaching the concepts involved for programming, perhaps even for those who won’t be able to pick up the concepts in a regular learning curriculum but it’s definitely intended as a pre-programming course[/quote]
All depends on the teacher. If you have a shitty one like we have, you aren’t going far with anything. The worst thing is that we learn to use depreciated stuff in Java and he won’t really take a stance when confronted on it.

Read full topic

item.title: Alice
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

Hash1:

The educators on the website look like: yo i did binaries and fortran in the past lemme teach yo programming.

fortran is interesting, i want to learn it. In fact, I find retro-computing interesting in general.

Read full topic

It looks like shit, but then again it is meant to help grasp the concept of programming.

item.title: Alice
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

Lin:

If your class is a high school class I advise you not taking it. It will be a complete waste of time and teach you how to program fast but inefficiently.

It’s a college class and I would drop it but it’s also a requirement for any other programming classes that I will be able to take later on. For example, I will be taking C# next term.

Read full topic
